Name: Administrative Division
Description: This type is for administrative divisions of countries of any level below the country itself and above city or town. Examples are Australian states, US states and counties, Canadian provinces, and French departments. This type should also be used for territories; many territories will be typed as both administrative division and country, since, depending on context, they may be considered as either.

Properties.Name: First level division of
Properties.Description: The country that this region, state, province etc. is first level administrative division of.

Properties.Name: Second level division of
Properties.Description: The country that this county, canton, department, district, etc. is second level administrative division of.

Properties.Name: Third level division of
Properties.Description: Administratively, third-level divisions have two levels of administration between their governments and the national government.

Properties.Name: Fourth level division of
Properties.Description: Administratively, fourth-level divisions have three levels of administration between their governments and the national government.
